p: CDV was mainly detected in the Canidae family with an overall prevalence below 10 %. Viral RNA was only recorded between 2005 and 2008 with a prevalence peak in the first year among the wolf population (67 %) followed by a drop down, suggesting an epizootic behaviour of the virus. Similar infection pattern has been documented in several animal species worldwide [ 41], including in Europe [ 21, 42, 43], with CDV often implicated in disease outbreaks and mortality events. The highly infectious nature of CDV [ 44] may explain the sudden increase in prevalence.
